name: Novotel Bangkok Platinum Pratunam

reviews.text: From the airport, take the airport express train (b2 at the airport) for 40 baht only. A taxi into the city wld cost 400 bahts. Get off at the 2 nd last stop (RATCHAPRAROP) , it takes about 20 min max. Take the lift down to street level and walk against traffic. You will pass by pratunum clothes market n several other street malls . The pavements v bad thu. Its a 20 min walk and u will have to cross a 5 lane road either by a zebra crossing or an overhead bridge. But the hotel is easy enuf to find. If you get lost just mention PLATINUM mall .everyone knows it.lol.
reviews.title: Great location , comfy beds :)

reviews.text: The room is v big n spacious. AC works great ! No tub in the rm thu. The beds v comfy.
reviews.title: Good location for shopping but not great staff.

reviews.text: They have thai buffets at their in house restaurant , the square, on certain nights for only 300 baht. Gd value for $. Theres a fd court at platinum mall level 6 but i didnt find the food that cheap. .
reviews.title: wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheap massage places at pallidum mall ( diagnally opp platinum mall ) for 150 baht / hr.
reviews.title: Great location , great service

reviews.text: Lots of street stalls outside the different malls frm 6 pm onwards. Some vendors jst set up blankets on the pavements while some are real pushcarts.
reviews.title: Better than expected plus free wifi

reviews.text: I recently checked into Novotel Bangkok Platinum during the Songkran weekend with a bunch of friends. (Btw, bad timing to be in Bangkok if you are there for shopping trip. Great if you are there for the water/mud fun).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Service at arrival was really great, fuss free and quick. Check-in was also handled very smoothly considering we are a big group of 20. Unfortunately, all our key cards did not work and we had to go all the way down to the lobby to get our cards checked and re-programmed. When we reach our room floor, to our frustration the key cards were not working still, and we are all stuck outside our room. There is no lobby phone, thank God for the Housekeeping maid who was cleaning a room nearby, with our sign language we managed to seek assistance in getting a FO staff up to our floors (we were staying on different floors) to check. After more waiting, we were glad that the key cards finally worked and we could enter our room.
reviews.title: Good location, decent property

reviews.text: Room is fairly large, clean and I was surprized to find iron/iron-board in my cupboard. Most of the regular amenities are in place.
reviews.title: Almost a perfect 10 except for one un-professional front desk executive,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bathroom: There is no bathtub, but the the standing bath is great once you get the hang of how to adjust the water temperature.
reviews.title: Smiles at Novotel Bangkok Platium

reviews.text: Welcome/turndown: There is no welcome amenities/fruits and no turndown service.
reviews.title: Bangkok on for amazing shopping!

reviews.text: I bought international lunch buffet at 799++ for my family.
reviews.title: Unacceptable buffet lunch at Novotel Platinum.

reviews.text: I have checked from website for this lunch before, they shown full international including of Japanese, Italian, Chinese and Thai food. But that's not true, I found that there are only Thai food, invaluable and not good.
reviews.title: A mixed bag, but tending to low value for money.

reviews.text: My parents said that unacceptable this meal. it's too expensive paid for what we have.
reviews.title: 4 days 3 nights Novotel Bangkok Platinum stay

reviews.text: However, there is no any inform from staff when we made reservation for this lunch. It's seem like they lied to us.
reviews.title: great location, friendly and helpful staffs
excellent service
reviews.text: I chose this hotel for a brief stay to attend a conference. Location close to the conference and being a known brand made me prefer this, though it is more expensive than other local brands and as I realized later, better hotels. I presume the hotel is located in a "happening" place in Bangkok - there are milling crowds, huge malls, many street vendors and eating joints all around the hotel. The hotel building looks in good shape - but this is one of those where one enters the building only to reach a different floor where the lobby is located. Lobby itself is funky and has great views of Bangkok skyline. Room is basic but reasonably spaced and modern and quite utilitarian - enough plug-points of all types at all convenient locations. Breakfast spread is good and the restaurant is spacious. The staff in the hotel were quite efficient and polite. The attitude of the concierge, though was quite surprising - when asked to hail a cab for the airport, they couldn't and were also unable to "persuade" the 10+ cabs that dropped of guests to take us to the Airport, They gave up after about 20min of "effort" and went back into the hotel, leaving us to step on to the road and do it ourselves - the baggage unattended at the entrance. May be it is a problem in the whole of Bangkok, but in which case I would have liked a hotel like Novotel to atleast prepare the overseas guests in advance. Spent an avoidable hour worrying about the flight on the way back.
If the purpose of my trip is to do clothes/shoe shopping, I may bump the rating up a star because it's attached to the mega fashion mall. My sisters spent hours there.
reviews.title: Depends what you are looking for

reviews.text: However, for me, who mainly wanted to relax and eat and get pampered, this place fell short of expectation.
reviews.title: Sawasdee Khrup, I love Novotel Bangkok Platinum

reviews.text: This hotel is relatively new, I believe it's less than 2-year old. So that's a plus as everything looks new. However, I was not wowed by anything. Check-in process was a bit frustrating. They were having difficulty locating our reservation (a first for me since using Cathay Pacific Holidays many times in different hotels). Also, not a lot of sitting areas in the lobby, so guests waiting to check in may have to stand around and wait. we arrived around noon and our rooms were not ready so we had to come back later. But when we came back in the evening, as we were handed the room keys, they told us our luggages will be brought up shortly. After waiting for 15 mins, we made a call and they told us they couldn't find our bags??? So we had to go down to lobby again to sort this out. It took them another 15 mins to get our luggages to us. Not impressed.
reviews.title: New hotel right above platinum mall!!

reviews.text: The room is nice and big. The twin beds are quite small, but the bedding is amazing. Really comfortable. With view facing the Central World. However, there are two things that kind of bothered me. First the electronic "blind" that is supposed to give privacy to the person using the bathroom is way too thin and transparent. Whoever selected the material needed to be fired. So if you are on a business trip and have to share the room with a co-worker. Well, good luck ;) Second thing, I was having trouble using the US plug in charger for my iPhone and iPad. It simply did not go in. I finally managed to push through in one of about seven outlets. This is also a first to me.
reviews.title: very best quality

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was the standard fares. Basically it fills up your stomach. They lack the variety that other 4-star hotels offer. For example, they don't have a cooked to order soup noodle station. The wait staff is also hit and miss. We usually ordered green tea in the morning. The first morning we were given the tea right the way. The next morning another waiter said they don't have any. Also, the cook at the omelette station did not understand English that well.
reviews.title: Novotel platinum bangkok stay

description: Blending comfort and technology, Novotel Bangkok Platinum is the perfect choice for your next holiday or business trip. Located in Bangkok vibrant and fashion district, the hotel is on top of Platinum mall, a short walk from Siam Square & Siam Paragon, near BTS stations and a quick drive from the airport railway. Featuring 283 well designed rooms, Novotel Bangkok Platinum offers two bars and one international restaurant " The Square", three meeting rooms & one ballroom, free Wifi internet & I Mac corner, outdoor infinity swimming pool, wellness & fitness center as well as access to an indoor secured car park.
